name: DV_IDENTIFIER
title: DV_IDENTIFIER
description: Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on. DV_IDENTIFIER is used to represent any identifier of a real thing, issued by some authority or agency.

element.short: Items which are truly boolean data
element.definition: Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on. DV_IDENTIFIER is used to represent any identifier of a real thing, issued by some authority or agency.
element.comment: Misuse: DV_IDENTIFIER is not used to express identifiers generated by the infrastructure to refer to information items; the types OBJECT_ID and OBJECT_REF and subtypes are defined for this purpose.

element.short: Optional authority which issues the kind of id used in the id field of this object
element.definition: Optional authority which issues the kind of id used in the id field of this object.

element.short: Optional organisation that assigned the id to the item being identified
element.definition: Optional organisation that assigned the id to the item being identified.
The identifier value. Often structured, according to the definition of the issuing authorityâ€™s rules.

element.short: Optional identifier type, such as prescription, or Social Security Number
element.definition: Optional identifier type, such as prescription, or Social Security Number. One day a controlled vocabulary might be possible for this.
